intro: You are assisting Mr Dawkins, a resident recovering from hip replacement surgery. He is eager to regain his independence but needs to follow specific mobility guidelines to ensure a safe recovery. Use empathetic communication to support him in mobilising safely, while reinforcing the importance of adhering to his movement restrictions and using his walking frame correctly.
description_html:
In this scenario, you will practice post-surgical mobility assistance following physiotherapist guidelines. Mr Dawkins has had a hip replacement and must avoid certain movements to prevent dislocation.

Learning objectives:

  • Follow physiotherapist guidelines for hip precautions
  • Guide safe bed-to-stand transfers
  • Ensure walking frame is used correctly
  • Prevent hip flexion beyond 90 degrees
  • Check posture during mobilization

resident.name: Mr Dawkins
goals: request help to get out of bed for washing
acknowledge physio advice about bending and leg positioning
attempt safe sitting up with carer's guidance
move legs carefully over bed edge
stand up with walking frame using safe method
learn why pulling on frame is unsafe
must_disclose: must not bend hip more than 90 degrees
refusals: should not stand by pulling on frame

safety.if_red_flag_then: stop mobilising ; correct technique; reinforce physio advice; escalate to nurse/physio if pain or technique prevents safe mobilisation

actions.title: Position walking frame
actions.prompt: You position the walking frame at the bedside, within easy reach for when Mr Dawkins stands.

actions.title: Guide sitting up
actions.prompt: You help Mr Dawkins sit up slowly, being careful not to bend his hip more than 90 degrees.

actions.title: Swing legs over
actions.prompt: You guide Mr Dawkins to carefully swing his legs over the edge of the bed, keeping them apart and aligned as advised by the physiotherapist.

actions.title: Put on shoes
actions.prompt: You help Mr Dawkins put on his shoes, as he cannot bend down to do this himself due to the hip surgery restrictions.

actions.title: Assist to stand
actions.prompt: You guide Mr Dawkins to push up from the bed with one hand before taking hold of the walking frame with both hands, ensuring he doesn't pull on the frame.

actions.title: Check posture
actions.prompt: You check that Mr Dawkins is standing upright with good posture, looking ahead rather than down.

actions.title: Walk to bathroom
actions.prompt: You walk alongside Mr Dawkins as he uses the walking frame to move safely towards the bathroom for washing.
